content.body: The GitHub hover popovers actually make text selection impossible. Try to select the username of the last commit shown on https://github.com/whatwg/fetch. It's not possible and breaks down differently in each browser.
Works for me in Chrome on Linux.
It's not jank if you do it slowly and the dialog pops up while you're doing it?
It's definitely jank here. There's ways to workaround it, but it's not a great experience.
emilio: could whatwg/dom/dom.bs be added to Searchfox as well? I just got "Your blame took too long to compute." from GitHub. :-(
content.formatted_body: emilio: could whatwg/dom/dom.bs be added to Searchfox as well? I just got "Your blame took too long to compute." from GitHub. :-(

content.body: annevk: I don't see why not... Add a whatwg-dom dir in https://github.com/mozsearch/mozsearch-mozilla/ much like whatwg-html?
content.formatted_body: annevk: I don't see why not... Add a whatwg-dom dir in https://github.com/mozsearch/mozsearch-mozilla/ much like whatwg-html?

content.body: Anyone willing to volunteer? For various reasons it'll be hard for me to make that contribution.

TabAtkins: I got a linking error for the quirks spec:
> LINK ERROR: Multiple possible 'body' element refs.
> Arbitrarily chose > https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/sections.html#the-body-element
> To auto-select one of the following refs, insert one of these lines into a <pre class=link-defaults> block:
> spec:html; type:element; text:body
> spec:epub-34; type:element; text:body

Having epub squat on HTML element names doesn't seem ideal?
content.formatted_body:
TabAtkins: I got a linking error for the quirks spec:

LINK ERROR: Multiple possible 'body' element refs.
Arbitrarily chose > https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/sections.html#the-body-element
To auto-select one of the following refs, insert one of these lines into a <pre class=link-defaults> block:

content.formatted_body:
In reply to @zcorpan:mozilla.org

TabAtkins: I got a linking error for the quirks spec:

LINK ERROR: Multiple possible 'body' element refs.
Arbitrarily chose > https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/sections.html#the-body-element
To auto-select one of the following refs, insert one of these lines into a <pre class=link-defaults> block:
spec:html; type:element; text:body
spec:epub-34; type:element; text:body

Having epub squat on HTML element names doesn't seem ideal?

Yeah that sucks, we should open an issue on them

content.body: I wasn't entirely sure as it seems they do in fact define a language that defines similar elements but they are not the same elements? And so I wasn't sure what to recommend them. But maybe we should file an issue anyway?

Interesting, neither Chromium nor WebKit seem to really implement the keep the global around for initial about:blank? Or maybe there are more ways to reset "is initial about:blank" than the specification suggests?

https://github.com/web-platform-tests/wpt/pull/51895 has my test. This result makes some sense to me as at least in WebKit the script environment is heavily intertwined with the navigable document. But maybe it's more subtle somehow?
TabAtkins: so it's https://www.w3.org/TR/epub-34/#sec-smil-body-elem which is a separate `body` element
content.formatted_body: TabAtkins: so it's https://www.w3.org/TR/epub-34/#sec-smil-body-elem which is a separate body element

content.body: Oh, hmmm
TabAtkins: so maybe we need some additional namespacing to distinguish the various elements?
content.formatted_body: TabAtkins: so maybe we need some additional namespacing to distinguish the various elements?

content.body: I mean we could put for=html on everything
Does anybody happen to know what exactly Chrome is doing here: https://github.com/whatwg/html/issues/8013? People keep reporting this as a bug to Firefox annoyingly often.

content.body: I don't think it's an "end" state. The parser PR is ready and approved by Simon, and the last open thread is done from our perspective. I haven't finished reviewing https://github.com/whatwg/html/pull/10629 but I think having it fast-follow seems fine to me. We'd love any reviews you might have time to submit though.
